result.title: Stakeholder Engagement Protocol
result.description: The stakeholder engagement protocol will support these stakeholder interactions and present a consistent approach. As a minimum, entails (I) meta-data and analysis of the stakeholder data base; (II) instructions on how stakeholders are to be approached, covering issues such as confidentiality, sensitivity and scientific transparency; (III) stakeholder-analysis based on key informant interviews covering topics such as power-interest grid, stakeholder-issue diagram, problem-frame stakeholder map and an ethical analysis grid. Linked to T3.1

project.title: European FOREST Research and Innovation Ecosystem

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

programme.title: Strengthening the European forest-based research and innovation ecosystem

category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

programme.title: Food, Bioeconomy Natural Resources, Agriculture and Environment

result.title: Rules of Procedures for the stakeholder engagement hub
result.description: RoP describe institutions and procedures for stakeholder engagement within the project and towards the European Partnership for Forestry. Represents the procedural design of EUFORE stakeholder engagement hub. As a minimum, entails (I) options for its institutions (working groups, secretariat, a stakeholder assembly); (II) options for deliberation procedures and decision taking; (III) connections to existing platforms and networks (i.e., FTP, other partnerships and national platforms). These are all design elements what will become the structure of the European Partnership on Forestry. Linked to T3.2

result.title: Communication, dissemination and exploitation plan
result.description: Document describing strategy, structure and timeline for all project communication and dissemination, and exploitation of results across the lifetime of the project. It includes target audiences, key communication channels and tools, key messages, proposed timing of activities, as well as methods of monitoring implementation and impact (KPIs). Linked to T4.1.

result.title: Societal expectations towards EU forests
result.description: This deliverable thematically focuses on societal expectations towards EU forests, and covers it through (I) literature review, (II) focus groups and interviews across Europe’s regions and (III) general survey that statistically representative for at least 20 European countries. The main findings of the survey and other analyses will be reported as a slide-deck that can be directly used in stakeholder meetings (linked to T2.1).

project.title: EIT Urban Mobility Business Plan 2023-2025

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: The European Institute of Innovation and Technology (EIT)

category.title: Legal Basis
category.description: Programme: Legal basis for research funding

category.title: Topic
category.description: Programme: Part of the Commission work programme implementing legal basis

result.title: The Co-governance methodology for the drOp project
result.description: A methodology of co-governance and co-responsibility as a result of the definition of a model of social innovation based on the civic and community role of the cultural and creative industries (CCIs).

result.title: Integration risk analysis
result.description: Integration risk assessment evaluates possibility of economical, scheduling, operational and budgetary risks and probability what may arise during Integration of the selected system modifications. After risk and probability has been identified a countermeasure is proposed to reduce any surprises what might affect the project planned outcomes. Detailed report for the assumptions, risk matrix and results is delivered.

project.title: Holistic heat energy management on ships by implementing innovative dynamic calculation models towards maximum waste heat capture and energy efficiency

result.title: Existing ship efficiency
result.description: By means of the final developed simulation model, the ship energy efficiency is calculated with respect to its initial system layout (case study, D1.4) and to the considered operating and weather conditions (D1.4 and D1.5). The deliverable reports results about the modelled and simulated ship energy behaviour and efficiency.

result.title: Project website
result.description: The project-specific website that will be set up will relate the project’s results and act as an information depository that will be accessible to the public and contribute to communicating the project results. The website will also demonstrate the main outcomes of the project, e.g. the heat recovery optimization tool.

result.title: Impact study
result.description: Current project is considering existing ship retrofit. Retrofit projects on cruise ships are usually done during ship operation. Therefore, feasibility study should be made to confirm modifications proposed to fulfil calculated and selected heat energy system arrangement. It will describe the physical modifications need to be made, how it will affect ship normal operations and give detailed budget estimation required for the ship.

result.title: Consolidated microgrid data
result.description: A consistent set of data, characterising the microgrid. The data will concern the energy demand by the type of loads, the current solar production and the meteorology with a sub-hourly time step.

category.title: Digital agenda
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development of digital technologies and the digitisation of the economy and society (known as ‘Digital transition’).

category.title: Clean air
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the clean air policy (National Emission Ceiling Directive) aiming to improve ambient air quality and tackle air pollution, to protect the environment and human health.

category.title: Artificial intelligence
category.description: This tracker monitors Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to the development and deployment of AI-based technologies and solutions. Projects that develop AI-tools as part of their research method are included

category.title: Climate action
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to both mitigating climate change (e.g., contributions to the reduction of greenhouse gas emissions) and adapting to climate change by building resilience (e.g., regarding floods, droughts, spatial planning and better governance, adaptation to changing climate in value chains, etc.).

category.title: Biodiversity
category.description: This tracker monitors the Horizon Europe’s financial contribution to Europe’s biodiversity’s path to recovery including species protection, ecosystem conservation, and habitat rehabilitation, all essential for resilience in climate adaptation and addressing ecosystem services but also environmental crime and the health-environment connection.

programme.title: Assessing the nexus of extraction, production, consumption, trade and behaviour patterns and of climate change action on biodiversity in the context of transformative change
